Certainly Stonehenge, clearly a neolitihc structure which dates from around 3000 to 2000BC, well under the 6000 year mark. In fact, it makes little sense to talk about "the bronze age" without reference to location and culture - different civilisations experienced these at different times. The bronze age in Britain, for example, is reckoned to start around 2100BC.
